resources.string: One ounce (28.35 grams) of almonds provides 6 grams of protein.\nOther high protein nuts include pistachios, which deliver 5.73 grams per 1-ounce (28.35 gram) serving and cashews, which contain 4.34 grams of protein per 1-ounce (28.35-gram) serving.

One cup (226 grams) of cottage cheese provides 28 grams of protein.\nOther high protein cheeses include cheddar cheese, which provides 3.96 grams of protein per 17-gram slice, and mozzarella, which provides 6.29 grams of protein per 1 ounce (28.35 grams).

One 7-ounce (200-gram) container provides 19.9 grams.\n Other yogurt products that are high in protein include unsweetened low fat yogurt, which provides 11.9 grams of protein per 8-ounce (227-gram) container, and kefir, which provides 9.21 grams of protein per 1 cup (243 mL).

One hundred grams (about 1/2 cup) of cooked lentils provides 9.02 grams of protein.\nOther high protein legumes include chickpeas, which provide 7.05 grams of protein per 100 grams cooked, and black beans, which provide 8.86 grams of protein 100 grams cooked.

Whey protein powder provides about 16.6 grams of protein per scoop (28.6 grams), while pea protein provides 15 grams of protein per scoop (20 grams).\nNote that the protein content per scoop differs between products, even when the scoop size is the same. Check the label of the products youâ€™re interested in for their specific protein content.

A 1/4 cup (29.5 grams) of pumpkin seeds provides 8.8 grams of protein.\nOther high protein seeds include sunflower seeds, which provide 7.25 grams per 1/4-cup (35-gram) serving, and flax seeds, which provide 7.5 grams of protein per 1/4-cup (42-gram) serving.
